title: Follicular Lymphoma International Prognostic Index (FLIPI)
description: Estimates overall survival in patients with follicular lymphoma based on 5 adverse prognostic factors to stratify patients into risk groups for treatment planning.

parameters.name: stage_3_or_4
parameters.description: Ann Arbor stage III or IV disease

result.name: flipi_score
result.description: FLIPI score ranging from 0 to 5 points

ranges.interpretation: Low risk group with 10-year overall survival of approximately 70%. These patients have a favorable prognosis and may be candidates for watchful waiting or less intensive therapy depending on symptoms and other clinical factors.

Intermediate risk group with 10-year overall survival of approximately 50%. These patients require careful monitoring and often benefit from systemic therapy. Treatment decisions should consider symptoms, tumor burden, and patient preferences.

High risk group with 10-year overall survival of approximately 35%. These patients typically require prompt treatment with combination chemotherapy or immunotherapy. Consider clinical trial enrollment and more intensive monitoring.

formula: Sum of adverse prognostic factors (1 point each): Age >60 years + >4 nodal sites + Elevated LDH + Hemoglobin <120 g/L + Stage III-IV
notes: FLIPI was developed from 4167 patients diagnosed between 1985-1992
Nodal sites refer to anatomical regions (e.g., cervical, axillary, inguinal, etc.)
Ann Arbor staging: Stage III involves lymph nodes on both sides of diaphragm; Stage IV involves extralymphatic organs
LDH elevation is defined as above the upper limit of normal for the testing laboratory
FLIPI-2 exists with different parameters but original FLIPI remains widely used
Mnemonic 'NoLaSH': Nodal areas, LDH, Age, Stage, Hemoglobin
